Unhappy Verse!  the witnes of my unhappy state,</br>Make thy self fluttring wings of thy fast flying thoght</br>And fly forth unto my Love, wheresoever she be.
Whether lying restlesse in heavy bed, or else</br>Sitting so cheerelesse at the cheerefull boord, or else Playing alone carelesse on hir heav'nly Virginalls.
If in Bed, tel her that mine eies can take no rest:</br>If at Board, tel her that my mouth can taste no food:</br>If at her Virginalls, tell her I can heare no mirth.
Asked why, say waking love suffreth no sleepe:</br>Say that raging love doth appall the weake stomak:</br>Say that lamenting love marreth the musicall.
Tel hir, that hir plesures were wont to lul me asleep</br>Tel hir, that hir beautie was wont to feed mine eies:</br>Tel hir, that her sweet tongue was wont to make me mirth
Now do I nightly waste, wanting my kindely rest:</br>Now do I daily starve, wanting my lively foode:</br>Now do I alwayes die, wanting my timely mirth.
And if I waste, who will bewaile my heavy chance?</br>And if I starve, who will record my cursed end?</br>And if I die, who will say, this was Immerito?</br>
